workflow.name: Customer financial report delivery system with Telegram and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
How it works

This workflow receives messages from Telegram using the Telegram Trigger node.

It detects the user‚Äôs action (/start or customer name) and decides whether to send a welcome message or perform a customer search.

The system fetches customer and access information from Google Sheets, checks if the user is authorized (based on chat IDs in the ‚ÄúAccess‚Äù sheet), and then proceeds accordingly.

If access is granted, the workflow aggregates financial and weight data, formats a summary report, and sends it back to the same Telegram chat automatically.

If access is denied or customer data is not found, it sends an appropriate ‚Äúno permission‚Äù or ‚Äúincorrect name‚Äù message to the user.

‚öôÔ∏è Set up steps

Connect your Telegram Bot API credentials in the Input user2, Send Report2, and related Telegram nodes.

Connect your Google Sheets account and update:

documentId ‚Üí link to your Google Sheet

sheetName ‚Üí replace with your actual sheet/tab names (‚ÄúAccess‚Äù, ‚ÄúSheet1‚Äù, etc.)

lookupColumn ‚Üí update to match column names used in your sheet (e.g., Customer name, Groups).

Replace placeholder text such as Your Custom Message and Your Custom Name with your actual message texts or variable names.

Test by sending a message to your Telegram bot with either /start or a known customer name.

Expected setup time: 10‚Äì15 minutes depending on how your Google Sheets and Telegram bot are configured.

Keep detailed field mapping or transformation logic (column names, sheet IDs) inside sticky notes within your workflow.

parameters.content:
# ü§ñ STEP 1: USER INPUT & DATA FETCH PROCESS

Telegram Trigger (Input user2)
Starts the workflow when a user sends a message to the Telegram bot.
‚Üí Passes message data (text, chat ID, username) to next node.

Code Node    
Reads the user message and detects intent:

/start or hi ‚Üí sets action = welcome

Empty message ‚Üí sets action = error

Otherwise ‚Üí sets action = searchCustomer and extracts customerName.

If Node (If4)
Checks if action = welcome.
‚Üí Yes ‚Üí Sends welcome message.
‚Üí No ‚Üí Continues to Google Sheets search.

Google Sheets Node
Looks up Customer name in the connected sheet.
Returns customer details if found.

Code Node (Code2)
Adds a found flag to show whether data exists.
Merges the result with the chat ID for next step.

Merge Node (Merge4)
Combines user input and sheet data for further processing in the next workflow step.

# How it works

This workflow receives messages from Telegram using the Telegram Trigger node.

It detects the user‚Äôs action (/start or customer name) and decides whether to send a welcome message or perform a customer search.

The system fetches customer and access information from Google Sheets, checks if the user is authorized (based on chat IDs in the ‚ÄúAccess‚Äù sheet), and then proceeds accordingly.

If access is granted, the workflow aggregates financial and weight data, formats a summary report, and sends it back to the same Telegram chat automatically.

If access is denied or customer data is not found, it sends an appropriate ‚Äúno permission‚Äù or ‚Äúincorrect name‚Äù message to the user.

# Set up steps

Connect your Telegram Bot API credentials in the Input user2, Send Report2, and related Telegram nodes.

Connect your Google Sheets account and update:

documentId ‚Üí link to your Google Sheet

sheetName ‚Üí replace with your actual sheet/tab names (‚ÄúAccess‚Äù, ‚ÄúSheet1‚Äù, etc.)

lookupColumn ‚Üí update to match column names used in your sheet (e.g., Customer name, Groups).

Replace placeholder text such as Your Custom Message and Your Custom Name with your actual message texts or variable names.

Test by sending a message to your Telegram bot with either /start or a known customer name.

Expected setup time: 10‚Äì15 minutes depending on how your Google Sheets and Telegram bot are configured.

Keep detailed field mapping or transformation logic (column names, sheet IDs) inside sticky notes within your workflow.

# ü§ñ STEP 2: ACCESS VALIDATION PROCESS

If Node
Checks if found = true.
‚Üí Yes: continue to Google Sheets
‚Üí No: send error message via Telegram

Google Sheets Node
Fetches rows from Access Sheet where Customers Group = $json["Groups"].

Merge Node
Combines data from ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and ‚ÄúGoogle Sheets‚Äù for validation.

Code Node (Check Match2)
Compares user chatId with ChatID1 and ChatID2 from sheet.
‚Üí Returns access: granted or access: denied.

Telegram Node
Sends message ‚ÄúEnter correct name‚Äù if no match is found.

# ü§ñ STEP 3: REPORT GENERATION & DELIVERY

If Node (If3)
Checks if access = granted.
‚Üí Yes ‚Üí continue to report generation.
‚Üí No ‚Üí send ‚ÄúNo permission‚Äù message via Telegram.

Google Sheets Node (Get row(s) in sheet5)
Retrieves customer data from Google Sheets based on customerName.
Provides raw financial data for calculation.

Code Node (Aggregate Summary2)
Calculates total debit, total credit, and balance.
Cleans and converts numeric values before summing.
‚Üí Output: { totalDebitMali, totalCreditMali, balanceMali }

Code Node (Format Details2)
Formats a detailed text report using emojis and labels.
Example: üí∞Debit, üí∏Credit, ‚öñÔ∏èBalance.

Code Node (Combine Summary + Details2)
Merges summary and detail sections into one final report text.

Telegram Node (Send Report2)
Sends the final formatted report back to the user in Telegram.

Telegram Node (No Permission)
If access was denied, this node sends a warning or rejection message to the user.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
